metadata.title: CVE-2016-2099 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in validators/DTD/DTDScanner.cpp in ApacheXerces C++ 3.1.3 and earlier allows context-dependent attackers to haveunspecified impact via an invalid character in an XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxerces-c-samples - 3.1.3+debian-2
libxerces-c3.2 - 3.1.3+debian-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xerces-c package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.3+debian-2').
